1-home.name: ^o.intro_book.name.home
1-home.text:
Welcome to the §4How to Train Your Dragon Add-On§r! For help, check out §qGet Started§r!

§1(You can craft this Book again using 1 Dragon Scale of any kind!)§r~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~Join the §mGamemode One§r community!~LINEBREAK~Discord: §8discord.gg/gamemode§r~LINEBREAK~Bluesky: §8@gamemodeone.com§r~LINEBREAK~TikTok: §8tiktok.com/@gmode_one§r~LINEBREAK~Instagram: §8instagram.com/gamemodeone§r~LINEBREAK~X: §8x.com/gmodeone§r

page_1_1.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_1_1
page_1_1.text: You can find different species of wild dragons in your world! Most dragons eat meat and fish, but §nGronckles§r only eat rocks! There are more details on dragon differences in the §4Book of Dragons§r!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~Build a bond by feeding them, giving them a saddle, and flying around with them.

page_1_2.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_1_2
page_1_2.text: Dragons can be skittish and will fly away from you. If you're §4holding a weapon, they might attack instead§r!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~Try §1sneaking§r when you first encounter a wild dragon, and offer some food.~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~A dragon is §qtamed§r at §1Trust Level 3§.

page_1_3.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_1_3
page_1_3.text: When you've tamed a wild dragon, it will show you that it is ready for a §nDragon Saddle§r! Use the scale that it gives you to craft a §nForge§r, and then you can craft a saddle.~LINEBREAK~Hold a dragon saddle and interact with the dragon to equip it. You'll be able to §1name your dragon§r!

page_1_4.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_1_4
page_1_4.text: When you have saddled a dragon, interact with them to hop on their back! You can direct them anywhere, and even fly into the sky with a jump!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~Keep an eye on the dragon's §1stamina§r, as dragons can only fly for so long before they need a break!

page_1_5.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_1_5
page_1_5.text:
The §4Book of Dragons§r contains everything we know about every dragon we know of!

It has information on where different dragons are located, what they prefer to eat, and more! You can find how to craft it under §1Utility§r in the §lRecipes§r section.

page_2_1.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_2_1
page_2_1.text: ~LINEBREAK~Use INTERACT ( :_input_key.use: ) to:~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~ - feed a dragon when holding food (and they are hungry or hurt)~LINEBREAK~ - apply a saddle, armor, or paint~LINEBREAK~ - start riding a saddled dragon~LINEBREAK~ - pet a dragon that wants to be pet

page_2_2.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_2_2
page_2_2.text:
~LINEBREAK~While sneaking ( :_input_key.sneak: ),

Use INTERACT ( :_input_key.use: ) 

on a tamed dragon to make them sit or stand. You cannot ride a dragon unless it is standing.

page_2_3.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_2_3
page_2_3.text: ~LINEBREAK~After using INTERACT on a saddled dragon, you can use the MOVE inputs to control where the dragon goes while you are riding it! Forwards, backwards, or side to side!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~Press JUMP ( :_input_key.jump: ) to start flying!

page_2_4.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_2_4
page_2_4.text: Ride a dragon and JUMP ( :_input_key.jump: ) to fly. Use the MOVE inputs to go forwards, backwards, or side to side.~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~While moving forward, the dragon will fly in the direction you LOOK.~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~§1When flying, hold JUMP for a speed boost§r!

page_2_5.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_2_5
page_2_5.text: When flying on a dragon, you can PUNCH/ATTACK ( :_input_key.attack: ) in order to have the dragon perform a ranged attack!

page_3_1.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_3_1
page_3_1.text:
The more you care for your tamed dragon, the more your bond will grow! As your bond improves, the dragon becomes stronger and you can interact with them in new ways.~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~Dragons will tell you when they §1want§r something with a §1thought bubble§r above their head. If you help them out, their trust in you will grow!

You can also build your bond further by doing activities together like §1flying§r or §1fighting mobs§r!

page_3_2.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_3_2
page_3_2.text: As the Trust Level increases, you can observe your dragon's skills improving in health, attack damage, and stamina!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~You can see the amount of hearts the dragon has when you are riding them. You can §1heal§r a hurt dragon by feeding them any edible food!

page_3_3.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_3_3
page_3_3.text: A tamed dragon that is seated will periodically get itchy, or sleepy.~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~When a seated dragon scratches, they have a chance to drop some §1dragon scales§r, which are an important resource for crafting armor!

page_3_4.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_3_4
page_3_4.text: Once you have a tamed dragon, you can summon it with the §nDragon Horn§r! If your tamed dragon loses all health, you can summon it after it recovers.~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~You can also use the horn to release a dragon. Beware this is a §4destructive§r action, and you will never see that particular dragon again.

page_3_5.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_3_5
page_3_5.text:
You can add visuals to your dragon with paint or armor!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~§lFor Paint§r: Get any vanilla dye in Minecraft, and interact with your dragon while holding it in order to apply the paint to them! You can remove paint using a §1bucket of water or lava§r.

§lFor Armor§r: You can equip §nDragon Armor§r by holding it and interacting with a dragon. You can remove armor by using §1shears§r.

page_4_1.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_1
page_4_1.text: The §nForge§r is where you will craft various things for your dragons and for yourself- like Dragon Armor, the Dragon Horn, and Rider Scale Armor!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~You can craft a Forge on a vanilla crafting table using §1Cobblestone§r surrounding any §1Dragon Scale§r.

page_4_2.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_2
page_4_2.text:
You can't ride your dragon without a saddle!

Craft it using 3 §1Leather§r and an §1Iron Ingot§r at a §nForge§r!

page_4_3_subpage_1.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_3_subpage_1
page_4_3_subpage_1.text: You can craft the Book of Dragons by using 3 §1paper§r at the §nForge§r

page_4_3_subpage_2.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_3_subpage_2
page_4_3_subpage_2.text: A dragon horn helps you find your lost dragons by allowing them to be called back to you!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~You can craft one using 5 §1Copper Ingots§r at the §nForge§r!

page_4_4_subpage_1.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_4_subpage_1
page_4_4_subpage_1.text:
You can create and equip Dragon Armor on your dragons to give them a cool look!

You can craft it using §1Iron Ingots§r at the §nForge§r.

page_4_4_subpage_2_1.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_4_subpage_2_1
page_4_4_subpage_2_1.text: Using §1Dragon Scales§r, you can craft Helmets, Chestplates, Leggings, and Boots from each kind of dragon scale to match that dragon!~LINEBREAK~~LINEBREAK~The layout for the crafting recipes are the same as the vanilla crafting recipes for that armor slot.

page_4_4_subpage_2_2.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_4_subpage_2_2
page_4_4_subpage_2_2.text: Use 5 Dragon Scales of the preferred dragon species at the §nForge§r to make a Helmet for yourself likened to that dragon.

page_4_4_subpage_2_3.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_4_subpage_2_3
page_4_4_subpage_2_3.text: Use 8 Dragon Scales of the preferred dragon species at the §nForge§r to make a Chestplate for yourself likened to that dragon.

page_4_4_subpage_2_4.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_4_subpage_2_4
page_4_4_subpage_2_4.text: Use 7 Dragon Scales of the preferred dragon species at the §nForge§r to make Leggings for yourself likened to that dragon.

page_4_4_subpage_2_5.name: ^o.intro_book.name.page_4_4_subpage_2_5
page_4_4_subpage_2_5.text: Use 4 Dragon Scales of the preferred dragon species at the §nForge§r to make Boots for yourself likened to that dragon.
